<h4 data-start="6917" data-end="6955"><strong data-start="6922" data-end="6955">Step 5: Configure URL Routing</strong></h4>
<p data-start="6957" data-end="7023">In the <code data-start="6964" data-end="6973">urls.py</code> of your <code data-start="6982" data-end="6989">stock</code> app, add a route to map the view.</p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="7025" data-end="7171"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none rounded-t-[5px]">python</div><div class="sticky top-9"><div class="absolute end-0 bottom-0 flex h-9 items-center pe-2"><div class="bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary flex items-center rounded-sm px-2 font-sans text-xs"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># stock/urls.py</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> django.urls </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> path
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> . </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> views

urlpatterns = [
    path(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">''</span></span><span>, views.isin_view, name=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'isin_view'</span></span><span>),
]
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="7173" data-end="7269">Next, include the app’s URLs in the <strong data-start="7209" data-end="7226">project-level</strong> <code data-start="7227" data-end="7236">urls.py</code> (i.e., <code data-start="7244" data-end="7267">stock_scraper/urls.py</code>).</p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="7271" data-end="7504"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none rounded-t-[5px]">python</div><div class="sticky top-9"><div class="absolute end-0 bottom-0 flex h-9 items-center pe-2"><div class="bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary flex items-center rounded-sm px-2 font-sans text-xs"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># stock_scraper/urls.py</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> django.contrib </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> admin
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> django.urls </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> path, include

urlpatterns = [
    path(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'admin/'</span></span><span>, admin.site.urls),
    path(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">''</span></span><span>, include(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'stock.urls'</span></span><span>)),  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Include the stock app's URLs</span></span><span>
]
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="7506" data-end="7509">
<h3 data-start="7511" data-end="7548"><strong data-start="7515" data-end="7548">Step 6: Run the Django Server</strong></h3>
<ol data-start="7550" data-end="7828">
<li data-start="7550" data-end="7624">
<p data-start="7553" data-end="7578"><strong data-start="7553" data-end="7577">Migrate the database</strong>:</p>

<h4 data-start="742" data-end="781"><strong data-start="747" data-end="781">Step 2: Clean Folder Structure</strong></h4>
<p data-start="783" data-end="870">Vite's default structure is good for most cases, but let's clean it up and organize it:</p>
<ul data-start="871" data-end="1155">
<li data-start="871" data-end="956">
<p data-start="873" data-end="956"><strong data-start="873" data-end="893"><code data-start="875" data-end="891">src/components</code></strong>: For reusable components like input forms and result displays.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="957" data-end="1017">
<p data-start="959" data-end="1017"><strong data-start="959" data-end="974"><code data-start="961" data-end="972">src/pages</code></strong>: For specific pages such as the home page.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1018" data-end="1114">
<p data-start="1020" data-end="1114"><strong data-start="1020" data-end="1038"><code data-start="1022" data-end="1036">src/services</code></strong>: For API requests (e.g., ISIN to company name lookup, stock data scraping).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1115" data-end="1155">
<p data-start="1117" data-end="1155"><strong data-start="1117" data-end="1132"><code data-start="1119" data-end="1130">src/types</code></strong>: For TypeScript types.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="1157" data-end="1169">For example:</p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="1170" data-end="1427"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none rounded-t-[5px]">pgsql</div><div class="sticky top-9"><div class="absolute end-0 bottom-0 flex h-9 items-center pe-2"><div class="bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary flex items-center rounded-sm px-2 font-sans text-xs"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre!"><span><span>my-stock-scraper/
├── src/

│   │   ├── ISINForm.tsx
│   │   └── StockResults.tsx

<h4 data-start="1429" data-end="1463"><strong data-start="1434" data-end="1463">Step 3: Responsive Layout</strong></h4>
<ul data-start="1464" data-end="1623">
<li data-start="1464" data-end="1620">
<p data-start="1466" data-end="1620">You can use <strong data-start="1478" data-end="1493">CSS Flexbox</strong> or <strong data-start="1497" data-end="1509">CSS Grid</strong> for creating a responsive layout, or you can use a UI framework like <strong data-start="1579" data-end="1595">Tailwind CSS</strong> to speed up the process.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<ol data-start="1624" data-end="2111">
<li data-start="1624" data-end="1748">
<p data-start="1627" data-end="1655">To install <strong data-start="1638" data-end="1654">Tailwind CSS</strong>:</p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="1659" data-end="1748"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none rounded-t-[5px]">bash</div><div class="sticky top-9"><div class="absolute end-0 bottom-0 flex h-9 items-center pe-2"><div class="bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary flex items-center rounded-sm px-2 font-sans text-xs"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-bash"><span><span>npm install -D tailwindcss postcss autoprefixer
npx tailwindcss init
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
</li>
<li data-start="1750" data-end="1983">

<p data-start="2398" data-end="2438">Here’s an example of <strong data-start="2419" data-end="2437"><code data-start="2421" data-end="2435">ISINForm.tsx</code></strong>:</p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="2439" data-end="3187"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none rounded-t-[5px]">tsx</div><div class="sticky top-9"><div class="absolute end-0 bottom-0 flex h-9 items-center pe-2"><div class="bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary flex items-center rounded-sm px-2 font-sans text-xs"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-tsx"><span><span><span class="hljs-comment">// src/components/ISINForm.tsx</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title class_">React</span></span><span>, { useState } </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">'react'</span></span><span>;

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">interface</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title class_">Props</span></span><span> {
  </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">onSubmit</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-function">(<span class="hljs-params">isin: <span class="hljs-built_in">string</span></span></span></span><span>) =&gt; </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">void</span></span><span>;
}

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">const</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title class_">ISINForm</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-title class_">React</span></span><span>.</span><span><span class="hljs-property">FC</span></span><span>&lt;</span><span><span class="hljs-title class_">Props</span></span><span>&gt; = </span><span><span class="hljs-function">(<span class="hljs-params">{ onSubmit }</span></span></span><span>) =&gt; {
  </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">const</span></span><span> [isin, setIsin] = </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">useState</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">''</span></span><span>);

  </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">const</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">handleSubmit</span></span><span> = (</span><span><span class="hljs-params">e: React.FormEvent</span></span><span>) =&gt; {
    e.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">preventDefault</span></span><span>();
    </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">onSubmit</span></span><span>(isin);
  };

  </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> (
    </span><span><span class="language-xml"><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">form</span></span></span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">onSubmit</span></span><span>=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">{handleSubmit}</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">className</span></span><span>=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"space-y-4"</span></span><span>&gt;
      </span><span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">input</span></span></span><span>
        </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">type</span></span><span>=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"text"</span></span><span>
        </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">value</span></span><span>=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">{isin}</span></span><span>
        </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">onChange</span></span><span>=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">{(e)</span></span><span> =&gt; setIsin(e.target.value)}
        placeholder="Enter ISIN"
        className="border px-4 py-2"
      /&gt;
      </span><span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">button</span></span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">type</span></span><span>=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"submit"</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">className</span></span><span>=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"bg-blue-500 text-white px-4 py-2 rounded"</span></span><span>&gt;
        Fetch Data
      </span><span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">button</span></span></span><span>&gt;
    </span><span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">form</span></span></span><span>&gt;
  );
};

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">export</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">default</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title class_">ISINForm</span></span><span>;
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title class_">React</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">'react'</span></span><span>;

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">const</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title class_">StockResults</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-title class_">React</span></span><span>.</span><span><span class="hljs-property">FC</span></span><span>&lt;</span><span><span class="hljs-title class_">Props</span></span><span>&gt; = </span><span><span class="hljs-function">(<span class="hljs-params">{ data }</span></span></span><span>) =&gt; {

      </span><span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">h3</span></span></span><span>&gt;Metrics:</span><span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">h3</span></span></span><span>&gt;

<h3 data-start="3709" data-end="3745"><strong data-start="3713" data-end="3745">2. Set Up Vitest for Testing</strong></h3>

<h4 data-start="4281" data-end="4309"><strong data-start="4286" data-end="4309">Step 3: Write Tests</strong></h4>
<p data-start="4311" data-end="4357">Create a test for the <strong data-start="4333" data-end="4345">ISINForm</strong> component.</p>

<h2 data-start="5697" data-end="5726">Assumptions or Limitations</h2>
<ul data-start="5728" data-end="6018">
<li data-start="5728" data-end="5810">
<p data-start="5730" data-end="5810">The app only supports stock data lookup using ISIN codes for specific companies.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5811" data-end="5909">
<p data-start="5813" data-end="5909">The scraping functionality relies on <strong data-start="5850" data-end="5865">Screener.in</strong> and may fail if the site structure changes.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5910" data-end="6018">
<p data-start="5912" data-end="6018">The stock data is fetched from external APIs, which may result in rate limits or errors from time to time.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 data-start="6020" data-end="6047">Architecture Explanation</h2>
<ul data-start="6049" data-end="6310">
<li data-start="6049" data-end="6139">
<p data-start="6051" data-end="6139"><strong data-start="6051" data-end="6063">Frontend</strong>: Built with <strong data-start="6076" data-end="6085">React</strong> and <strong data-start="6090" data-end="6104">TypeScript</strong>, using <strong data-start="6112" data-end="6120">Vite</strong> as the build tool.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="6140" data-end="6202">
<p data-start="6142" data-end="6202"><strong data-start="6142" data-end="6153">Testing</strong>: <strong data-start="6155" data-end="6165">Vitest</strong> is used for unit testing components.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="6203" data-end="6310">
<p data-start="6205" data-end="6310"><strong data-start="6205" data-end="6217">Scraping</strong>: Data is scraped from <strong data-start="6240" data-end="6255">Screener.in</strong> and fetched from external APIs like <strong data-start="6292" data-end="6309">Alpha Vantage</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ul>

We can configure the testing part to use <strong data-start="127" data-end="139"><code data-start="129" data-end="137">pytest</code></strong> for testing the React components. However, <strong data-start="183" data-end="195"><code data-start="185" data-end="193">pytest</code></strong> is mainly used for testing Python code, and React components are usually tested with <strong data-start="281" data-end="289">Jest</strong> or <strong data-start="293" data-end="303">Vitest</strong> for JavaScript/TypeScript projects.</p>
<p data-start="342" data-end="447">Since you requested <strong data-start="362" data-end="374"><code data-start="364" data-end="372">pytest</code></strong>, I'll clarify the situation and provide an appropriate testing strategy:</p>
<ol data-start="449" data-end="948">
<li data-start="449" data-end="666">
<p data-start="452" data-end="666"><strong data-start="452" data-end="469">React Testing</strong>: You’ll generally use <strong data-start="492" data-end="500">Jest</strong> (or <strong data-start="505" data-end="515">Vitest</strong>) for testing React components. But if the requirement is for <strong data-start="577" data-end="589"><code data-start="579" data-end="587">pytest</code></strong>, it may refer to testing your <strong data-start="620" data-end="635">backend API</strong> (which would be Python-based).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="668" data-end="948">
<p data-start="671" data-end="690"><strong data-start="671" data-end="688">React Testing</strong>:</p>
<ul data-start="694" data-end="948">
<li data-start="694" data-end="816">
<p data-start="696" data-end="816">For testing React components, you would typically use <strong data-start="750" data-end="758">Jest</strong> with <strong data-start="764" data-end="789">React Testing Library</strong> or <strong data-start="793" data-end="803">Vitest</strong> (for Vite).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="820" data-end="948">
<p data-start="822" data-end="948"><strong data-start="822" data-end="834"><code data-start="824" data-end="832">pytest</code></strong> is used for <strong data-start="847" data-end="857">Python</strong> testing, but we can use <strong data-start="882" data-end="894"><code data-start="884" data-end="892">pytest</code></strong> in a <strong data-start="900" data-end="918">Django backend</strong> or any Python-based services.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ol>
<p data-start="950" data-end="1213">If you still want to follow the <strong data-start="982" data-end="994"><code data-start="984" data-end="992">pytest</code></strong> route for <strong data-start="1005" data-end="1016">backend</strong> testing (if you’re using any Python backend, e.g., for APIs), we can set up <strong data-start="1093" data-end="1105"><code data-start="1095" data-end="1103">pytest</code></strong> to test <strong data-start="1114" data-end="1124">Python</strong> code separately, while using <strong data-start="1154" data-end="1162">Jest</strong> (or <strong data-start="1167" data-end="1177">Vitest</strong>) for <strong data-start="1183" data-end="1212">frontend React components</strong>.</p>
<hr data-start="1215" data-end="1218">
<h3 data-start="1220" data-end="1289"><strong data-start="1224" data-end="1289">Testing Strategy for Your Project (with <code data-start="1266" data-end="1274">pytest</code> for backend)</strong></h3>
<ol data-start="1291" data-end="1603">
<li data-start="1291" data-end="1434">
<p data-start="1294" data-end="1434"><strong data-start="1294" data-end="1306">Frontend</strong>:<br>
Use <strong data-start="1316" data-end="1324">Jest</strong> or <strong data-start="1328" data-end="1338">Vitest</strong> for testing React components (because <strong data-start="1377" data-end="1389"><code data-start="1379" data-end="1387">pytest</code></strong> is not suited for React component testing).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1439" data-end="1603">
<p data-start="1442" data-end="1470"><strong data-start="1442" data-end="1453">Backend</strong> (if applicable):</p>
<ul data-start="1474" data-end="1603">
<li data-start="1474" data-end="1603">
<p data-start="1476" data-end="1603">Use <strong data-start="1480" data-end="1492"><code data-start="1482" data-end="1490">pytest</code></strong> to test any Python-related backend code or API endpoints (if your app interacts with a Python API or scraper).</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ol>
<p data-start="1605" data-end="1646">Let’s proceed with a <strong data-start="1626" data-end="1636">hybrid</strong> approach:</p>

</li>
<li data-start="1730" data-end="1822">
<p data-start="1732" data-end="1822"><strong data-start="1732" data-end="1743">Backend</strong>: Use <strong data-start="1749" data-end="1761"><code data-start="1751" data-end="1759">pytest</code></strong> for testing any Python-related functionality (if necessary).</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1824" data-end="1827">
<h3 data-start="1829" data-end="1874"><strong data-start="1833" data-end="1874">1. Setting up React Testing with Jest</strong></h3>

</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">test</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'renders ISIN form and submits'</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-function">() =&gt;</span></span><span> {

You can write <strong data-start="3806" data-end="3818"><code data-start="3808" data-end="3816">pytest</code></strong> tests for those functions.</p>
<p data-start="3847" data-end="3912">Here’s an example <strong data-start="3865" data-end="3886"><code data-start="3867" data-end="3884">test_scraper.py</code></strong> for the scraper function:</p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="3914" data-end="4314"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none rounded-t-[5px]">python</div><div class="sticky top-9"><div class="absolute end-0 bottom-0 flex h-9 items-center pe-2"><div class="bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary flex items-center rounded-sm px-2 font-sans text-xs"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># test_scraper.py</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> stock.scraper </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> scrape_stock_data

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">test_scrape_stock_data</span></span><span>():
    company_name = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Reliance Industries"</span></span><span>
    ticker = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"RELIANCE"</span></span><span>
    
    data = scrape_stock_data(company_name, ticker)

class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words light"><p data-start="0" data-end="195">Absolutely! Here’s a <strong data-start="21" data-end="43">step-by-step guide</strong> on how to create a <strong data-start="63" data-end="84">GitHub repository</strong>, upload your project code, and add a <strong data-start="122" data-end="135">README.md</strong> file using the <strong data-start="151" data-end="169">GitHub website</strong>, along with explanations.</p>
<hr data-start="197" data-end="200">
<h2 data-start="202" data-end="233">What is a GitHub Repository?</h2>
<ul data-start="235" data-end="593">
<li data-start="235" data-end="402">
<p data-start="237" data-end="402">A <strong data-start="239" data-end="267">GitHub repository (repo)</strong> is like a project folder stored online where you keep your project files, track changes, collaborate with others, and share your code.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="403" data-end="593">
<p data-start="405" data-end="593">A <strong data-start="407" data-end="420">README.md</strong> is a Markdown file that lives in the root of your repo. It’s the front page of your project on GitHub, where you describe your project, setup instructions, usage, and more.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="595" data-end="598">
<h1 data-start="600" data-end="651">Step-by-Step: Create a GitHub Repo and Add README</h1>
<h3 data-start="653" data-end="692">1. <strong data-start="660" data-end="692">Sign in or Sign up on GitHub</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="694" data-end="850">
<li data-start="694" data-end="735">
<p data-start="696" data-end="735">Go to <a data-start="702" data-end="734" rel="noopener" target="_new" class="" href="https://github.com/">github.com</a>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="736" data-end="801">
<p data-start="738" data-end="801">If you don’t have an account, click <strong data-start="774" data-end="785">Sign up</strong> and create one.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="802" data-end="850">
<p data-start="804" data-end="850">If you have one, click <strong data-start="827" data-end="838">Sign in</strong> and log in.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="852" data-end="855">
<h3 data-start="857" data-end="891">2. <strong data-start="864" data-end="891">Create a New Repository</strong></h3>
<ol data-start="893" data-end="1572">
<li data-start="893" data-end="990">
<p data-start="896" data-end="990">Once signed in, in the upper-right corner, click the <strong data-start="949" data-end="954">+</strong> icon and select <strong data-start="971" data-end="989">New repository</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="992" data-end="1539">
<p data-start="995" data-end="1013">Fill out the form:</p>
<ul data-start="1018" data-end="1539">
<li data-start="1018" data-end="1095">
<p data-start="1020" data-end="1095"><strong data-start="1020" data-end="1039">Repository name</strong>: Choose a name for your project, e.g., <code data-start="1079" data-end="1094">stock-scraper</code>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1099" data-end="1200">
<p data-start="1101" data-end="1200"><strong data-start="1101" data-end="1116">Description</strong> (optional): Write a short description, e.g., “A React + Python stock data scraper.”</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1204" data-end="1326">
<p data-start="1206" data-end="1326"><strong data-start="1206" data-end="1227">Public or Private</strong>: Choose <strong data-start="1236" data-end="1246">Public</strong> (anyone can see it) or <strong data-start="1270" data-end="1281">Private</strong> (only you or invited collaborators can see).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1330" data-end="1451">
<p data-start="1332" data-end="1368"><strong data-start="1332" data-end="1367">Initialize this repository with</strong>:</p>
<ul data-start="1374" data-end="1451">
<li data-start="1374" data-end="1451">
<p data-start="1376" data-end="1451">Check <strong data-start="1382" data-end="1403">Add a README file</strong> (this creates an empty README.md you can edit).</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li data-start="1455" data-end="1539">
<p data-start="1457" data-end="1539">You can skip adding <code data-start="1477" data-end="1489">.gitignore</code> or license for now (you can add later if needed).</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li data-start="1541" data-end="1572">
<p data-start="1544" data-end="1572">Click <strong data-start="1550" data-end="1571">Create repository</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="1574" data-end="1577">
<h3 data-start="1579" data-end="1611">3. <strong data-start="1586" data-end="1611">Add or Edit README.md</strong></h3>
<ol data-start="1613" data-end="2428">
<li data-start="1613" data-end="1683">
<p data-start="1616" data-end="1683">After your repo is created, you will see the README.md file listed.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1685" data-end="1716">
<p data-start="1688" data-end="1716">Click on the README.md file.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1718" data-end="1788">
<p data-start="1721" data-end="1788">Click the <strong data-start="1731" data-end="1746">pencil icon</strong> (✏️) at the top right to edit the README.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1790" data-end="2326">
<p data-start="1793" data-end="1867">In the editor, write your project info using <strong data-start="1838" data-end="1850">Markdown</strong> syntax. Example:</p>

<ol data-start="2540" data-end="3028">
<li data-start="2540" data-end="2615">

</li>

</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
</li>
<li data-start="2693" data-end="2822">

<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="2732" data-end="2822"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none rounded-t-[5px]">bash</div><div class="sticky top-9"><div class="absolute end-0 bottom-0 flex h-9 items-center pe-2"><div class="bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary flex items-center rounded-sm px-2 font-sans text-xs"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-bash"><span><span>git remote add origin https://github.com/your-username/stock-scraper.git

</li>
<li data-start="2951" data-end="3028">
<p data-start="2954" data-end="2980">Push your files to GitHub:</p>

<hr data-start="3030" data-end="3033">
<h4 data-start="3035" data-end="3087">B. <strong data-start="3043" data-end="3087">Upload Files Directly via GitHub Website</strong></h4>
<ol data-start="3089" data-end="3371">
<li data-start="3089" data-end="3123">
<p data-start="3092" data-end="3123">Go to your repo page on GitHub.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3125" data-end="3166">
<p data-start="3128" data-end="3166">Click <strong data-start="3134" data-end="3146">Add file</strong> &gt; <strong data-start="3149" data-end="3165">Upload files</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3168" data-end="3277">
<p data-start="3171" data-end="3277">Drag and drop your project files (like <code data-start="3210" data-end="3216">src/</code>, <code data-start="3218" data-end="3232">package.json</code>, <code data-start="3234" data-end="3245">README.md</code> if you want to overwrite, etc.)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3279" data-end="3341">
<p data-start="3282" data-end="3341">Scroll down, add a commit message like “Add project files”.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3343" data-end="3371">
<p data-start="3346" data-end="3371">Click <strong data-start="3352" data-end="3370">Commit changes</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="3373" data-end="3376">
<h3 data-start="3378" data-end="3404">5. <strong data-start="3385" data-end="3404">Check Your Repo</strong></h3>

</li>
<li data-start="3477" data-end="3524">

</li>
<li data-start="3525" data-end="3643">
<p data-start="3527" data-end="3643">You can share the <strong data-start="3545" data-end="3557">repo URL</strong> (like <code data-start="3564" data-end="3612">https://github.com/your-username/stock-scraper</code>) when submitting your project.</p>
</li>
</ul>

Here's how to fix it step-by-step on Windows:</p>
<hr data-start="160" data-end="163">
<h2 data-start="165" data-end="187">Step 1: Install Git</h2>
<ol data-start="189" data-end="610">
<li data-start="189" data-end="297">
<p data-start="192" data-end="297">Go to the official Git website:<br data-start="223" data-end="226">
<a data-start="229" data-end="297" rel="noopener" target="_new" class="" href="https://git-scm.com/download/win">https://git-scm.com/download/win</a></p>
</li>
<li data-start="299" data-end="348">
<p data-start="302" data-end="348">Download the latest Git installer for Windows.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="350" data-end="581">
<p data-start="353" data-end="396">Run the installer and follow the prompts.</p>
<ul data-start="400" data-end="581">
<li data-start="400" data-end="581">
<p data-start="402" data-end="581">On the "Adjusting your PATH environment" step, choose <strong data-start="456" data-end="520">"Git from the command line and also from 3rd-party software"</strong> (recommended). This ensures Git works in PowerShell and CMD.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li data-start="583" data-end="610">
<p data-start="586" data-end="610">Finish the installation.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="612" data-end="615">

<li data-start="653" data-end="753">
<p data-start="656" data-end="753">Open a <strong data-start="663" data-end="670">new</strong> PowerShell or Command Prompt window (important: close and reopen so PATH updates).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="755" data-end="763">
<p data-start="758" data-end="763">Type:</p>
</li>
</ol>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="765" data-end="796"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none rounded-t-[5px]">powershell</div><div class="sticky top-9"><div class="absolute end-0 bottom-0 flex h-9 items-center pe-2"><div class="bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary flex items-center rounded-sm px-2 font-sans text-xs"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-powershell"><span>git --version

<hr data-start="1024" data-end="1027">
<h2 data-start="1029" data-end="1073">Step 4: Connect Your Local Repo to GitHub</h2>

</ul>
<p data-start="1216" data-end="1225">Then run:</p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="1227" data-end="1313"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none rounded-t-[5px]">powershell</div><div class="sticky top-9"><div class="absolute end-0 bottom-0 flex h-9 items-center pe-2"><div class="bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary flex items-center rounded-sm px-2 font-sans text-xs"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-powershell"><span>git remote add origin https://github.com/your-username/your-repo.git

<hr data-start="1315" data-end="1318">

<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="1358" data-end="1442"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none rounded-t-[5px]">powershell</div><div class="sticky top-9"><div class="absolute end-0 bottom-0 flex h-9 items-center pe-2"><div class="bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary flex items-center rounded-sm px-2 font-sans text-xs"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-powershell"><span>git add .

<hr data-start="1444" data-end="1447">
<h2 data-start="1449" data-end="1467">Additional Help</h2>
<ul data-start="1469" data-end="1582">
<li data-start="1469" data-end="1582">
<p data-start="1471" data-end="1582">If <code data-start="1474" data-end="1484">git push</code> asks for username/password, follow the instructions or set up SSH keys for easier authentication.</p>
</li>

<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="561" data-end="586"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none rounded-t-[5px]">bash</div><div class="sticky top-9"><div class="absolute end-0 bottom-0 flex h-9 items-center pe-2"><div class="bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary flex items-center rounded-sm px-2 font-sans text-xs"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-bash"><span><span>git branch -r
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="588" data-end="614">You’ll see something like:</p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="616" data-end="693"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none rounded-t-[5px]">bash</div><div class="sticky top-9"><div class="absolute end-0 bottom-0 flex h-9 items-center pe-2"><div class="bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary flex items-center rounded-sm px-2 font-sans text-xs"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre!"><span><span>origin/HEAD -&gt; origin/master
origin/master
origin/your-feature-branch
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="695" data-end="698">
<h2 data-start="700" data-end="739">3. Check your local commits &amp; status</h2>

git </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">log</span></span><span> --oneline
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="783" data-end="820">Make sure your changes are committed.</p>
<hr data-start="822" data-end="825">
<h2 data-start="827" data-end="865">4. Push to master branch explicitly</h2>
<p data-start="867" data-end="942">Even if you pushed to a new branch by mistake, push everything to <code data-start="933" data-end="941">master</code>:</p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="944" data-end="978"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none rounded-t-[5px]">bash</div><div class="sticky top-9"><div class="absolute end-0 bottom-0 flex h-9 items-center pe-2"><div class="bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary flex items-center rounded-sm px-2 font-sans text-xs"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-bash"><span><span>git push origin master
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="980" data-end="1077">If it gives an error (like non-fast-forward), force push (be careful with this if collaborating):</p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="1079" data-end="1121"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none rounded-t-[5px]">bash</div><div class="sticky top-9"><div class="absolute end-0 bottom-0 flex h-9 items-center pe-2"><div class="bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary flex items-center rounded-sm px-2 font-sans text-xs"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-bash"><span><span>git push origin master --force
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="1123" data-end="1126">
<h2 data-start="1128" data-end="1180">5. If push succeeds, refresh GitHub repo page at:</h2>
<p data-start="1182" data-end="1235"><code data-start="1182" data-end="1235">https://github.com/Laahir/stock_scraper/tree/master</code></p>
<p data-start="1237" data-end="1267">You should see your files now.</p>
<hr data-start="1269" data-end="1272">
<h2 data-start="1274" data-end="1336">6. If you still only see the "compare &amp; pull request" page:</h2>
<p data-start="1338" data-end="1410">Click on <strong data-start="1347" data-end="1359">Branches</strong> tab on GitHub repo page, locate your branch, then:</p>
<ul data-start="1412" data-end="1592">
<li data-start="1412" data-end="1468">
<p data-start="1414" data-end="1468">Click the <strong data-start="1424" data-end="1438">three dots</strong> (⋯) menu next to your branch.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1469" data-end="1526">
<p data-start="1471" data-end="1526">See if there is a <strong data-start="1489" data-end="1506">Delete branch</strong> or <strong data-start="1510" data-end="1518">Edit</strong> option.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1527" data-end="1592">
<p data-start="1529" data-end="1592">Or click the branch name and check if you can view files there.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1594" data-end="1597">

git push origin temp-branch
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="1795" data-end="1849">Then, merge manually from temp-branch to master using:</p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="1851" data-end="1927"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none rounded-t-[5px]">bash</div><div class="sticky top-9"><div class="absolute end-0 bottom-0 flex h-9 items-center pe-2"><div class="bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary flex items-center rounded-sm px-2 font-sans text-xs"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-bash"><span><span>git checkout master

<hr data-start="85" data-end="88">
<h1 data-start="90" data-end="105">Stock Scraper</h1>
<p data-start="107" data-end="368">This project allows you to fetch stock data from <strong data-start="156" data-end="171">Screener.in</strong> using <strong data-start="178" data-end="192">ISIN codes</strong>. However, during the implementation, we faced multiple challenges with <strong data-start="264" data-end="279">ISIN lookup</strong> and <strong data-start="284" data-end="303">API limitations</strong>, which led us to a <strong data-start="323" data-end="348">hard mapping approach</strong> for certain stocks.</p>
<h2 data-start="370" data-end="392">Problem Encountered</h2>
<ol data-start="394" data-end="1809">
<li data-start="394" data-end="667">
<p data-start="397" data-end="667"><strong data-start="397" data-end="418">ISIN Search Issue</strong>:<br data-start="419" data-end="422">
Initially, I attempted to search for stocks directly by their <strong data-start="487" data-end="495">ISIN</strong> codes. However, <strong data-start="512" data-end="527">Screener.in</strong> did not support ISIN-based searches. It only accepts stock tickers, so I was unable to use ISIN codes to fetch data directly from the site.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="669" data-end="1253">
<p data-start="672" data-end="797"><strong data-start="672" data-end="688">API Attempts</strong>:<br>
I explored <strong data-start="704" data-end="721">external APIs</strong> to convert ISINs into stock tickers. Here's a list of the APIs I attempted:</p>
<ul data-start="802" data-end="1253">
<li data-start="802" data-end="953">
<p data-start="804" data-end="953"><strong data-start="804" data-end="833">FinancialModelingPrep API</strong>: I tried using their ISIN search API, but it either didn’t provide results or failed to return the correct ticker data.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="957" data-end="1101">
<p data-start="959" data-end="1101"><strong data-start="959" data-end="980">Alpha Vantage API</strong>: While attempting to fetch stock data, the API key either didn’t work or the endpoint didn’t support ISIN-based queries.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1105" data-end="1253">
<p data-start="1107" data-end="1253"><strong data-start="1107" data-end="1126">Other Free APIs</strong>: I also searched for free APIs to convert ISINs to stock tickers but faced issues with access, rate limits, or incorrect data.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li data-start="1255" data-end="1809">
<p data-start="1258" data-end="1533"><strong data-start="1258" data-end="1274">Hard Mapping</strong>:<br>
After the external API attempts failed, I decided to <strong data-start="1332" data-end="1364">manually map the stock names</strong> and <strong data-start="1369" data-end="1380">tickers</strong> for a select list of stocks. This allowed me to bypass the ISIN lookup issue by directly searching for stocks via their ticker names on <strong data-start="1517" data-end="1532">Screener.in</strong>.</p>
<p data-start="1538" data-end="1809">However, <strong data-start="1547" data-end="1562">Screener.in</strong> requires using <strong data-start="1578" data-end="1600">NSE ticker symbols</strong> (e.g., <code data-start="1608" data-end="1618">RELIANCE</code> for <strong data-start="1623" data-end="1646">Reliance Industries</strong>) in the URL, not the full stock name (e.g., <strong data-start="1691" data-end="1714">Reliance Industries</strong>). So, I created a hard mapping to associate <strong data-start="1759" data-end="1774">stock names</strong> with their <strong data-start="1786" data-end="1808">NSE ticker symbols</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="1811" data-end="1814">
<h2 data-start="1816" data-end="1827">Solution</h2>
<h3 data-start="1829" data-end="1861"><strong data-start="1833" data-end="1861">Approach I Finally Used:</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="1863" data-end="2562">
<li data-start="1863" data-end="2357">
<p data-start="1865" data-end="2062"><strong data-start="1865" data-end="1899">Hard Mapping of Ticker Symbols</strong>:<br data-start="1900" data-end="1903">
After failing to find a working API solution, I created a manual mapping of <strong data-start="1981" data-end="1995">ISIN codes</strong> to <strong data-start="1999" data-end="2014">stock names</strong> and their corresponding <strong data-start="2039" data-end="2061">NSE ticker symbols</strong>.</p>
<p data-start="2068" data-end="2078">Example:</p>
<ul data-start="2081" data-end="2172">
<li data-start="2081" data-end="2123">
<p data-start="2083" data-end="2123"><strong data-start="2083" data-end="2106">Reliance Industries</strong> → <strong data-start="2109" data-end="2123"><code data-start="2111" data-end="2121">RELIANCE</code></strong></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2126" data-end="2169">
<p data-start="2128" data-end="2169"><strong data-start="2128" data-end="2157">Tata Consultancy Services</strong> → <strong data-start="2160" data-end="2169"><code data-start="2162" data-end="2167">TCS</code></strong></p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="2175" data-end="2357">This allowed me to construct the correct <strong data-start="2216" data-end="2231">Screener.in</strong> URL for each stock by using the corresponding <strong data-start="2278" data-end="2299">NSE ticker symbol</strong> in the URL (<code data-start="2312" data-end="2355">https://www.screener.in/company/&lt;ticker&gt;/</code>).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2359" data-end="2562">
<p data-start="2361" data-end="2562"><strong data-start="2361" data-end="2384">Fetching Stock Data</strong>:<br data-start="2385" data-end="2388">
After generating the correct ticker symbols for each stock, I used <strong data-start="2457" data-end="2483">Python's BeautifulSoup</strong> to scrape key metrics (like P/E ratio, market cap, etc.) from <strong data-start="2546" data-end="2561">Screener.in</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="2564" data-end="2597"><strong data-start="2568" data-end="2596">Tools and Libraries Used</strong>:</h3>
<ul data-start="2598" data-end="2812">
<li data-start="2598" data-end="2673">
<p data-start="2600" data-end="2673"><strong data-start="2600" data-end="2612">Requests</strong>: For making HTTP requests to <strong data-start="2642" data-end="2657">Screener.in</strong> and other APIs.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2674" data-end="2753">
<p data-start="2676" data-end="2753"><strong data-start="2676" data-end="2693">BeautifulSoup</strong>: For scraping stock data from the <strong data-start="2728" data-end="2743">Screener.in</strong> web page.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2754" data-end="2812">
<p data-start="2756" data-end="2812"><strong data-start="2756" data-end="2766">Python</strong>: Used for scraping and data extraction logic.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="2814" data-end="2817">
<h2 data-start="2819" data-end="2847">Development and Debugging</h2>
<p data-start="2849" data-end="3020">During the development of the scraper, I encountered several <strong data-start="2910" data-end="2939">syntax and logical errors</strong>. To resolve them, I turned to <strong data-start="2970" data-end="2981">ChatGPT</strong> for assistance. Here’s what was fixed:</p>
<ul data-start="3022" data-end="3292">
<li data-start="3022" data-end="3138">
<p data-start="3024" data-end="3138"><strong data-start="3024" data-end="3041">Syntax errors</strong>: I was able to get help fixing missing or mismatched parentheses and other Python syntax issues.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3139" data-end="3292">
<p data-start="3141" data-end="3292"><strong data-start="3141" data-end="3159">Logical errors</strong>: ChatGPT helped me fix issues like handling missing data during the scraping process and correcting the mapping of ISINs to tickers.</p>
</li>
</ul>

<li data-start="3719" data-end="3956">
<p data-start="3722" data-end="3956"><strong data-start="3722" data-end="3739">Enter an ISIN</strong>:<br data-start="3740" data-end="3743">
The script will prompt you to enter an <strong data-start="3785" data-end="3798">ISIN code</strong>. It will then attempt to fetch stock data for the corresponding company using the <strong data-start="3881" data-end="3911">hard-mapped ticker symbols</strong> and scrape information from <strong data-start="3940" data-end="3955">Screener.in</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="3958" data-end="3961">
<h2 data-start="3963" data-end="3977">Limitations</h2>
<ul data-start="3979" data-end="4238">
<li data-start="3979" data-end="4062">
<p data-start="3981" data-end="4062"><strong data-start="3981" data-end="4003">Limited Stock Data</strong>: Only stocks that are hard-mapped are currently supported.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4063" data-end="4238">
<p data-start="4065" data-end="4238"><strong data-start="4065" data-end="4096">No ISIN Support on Screener</strong>: The <strong data-start="4102" data-end="4117">Screener.in</strong> platform does not support ISIN-based searches, making it necessary to either use an external API or hard-map the stocks.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="4240" data-end="4243">
<h2 data-start="4245" data-end="4267">Future Improvements</h2>
<ul data-start="4269" data-end="4608">
<li data-start="4269" data-end="4356">
<p data-start="4271" data-end="4356"><strong data-start="4271" data-end="4294">Expand ISIN mapping</strong>: More stocks can be mapped to their corresponding ISIN codes.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4357" data-end="4510">
<p data-start="4359" data-end="4510"><strong data-start="4359" data-end="4408">Implement API-based ISIN to Ticker Conversion</strong>: If a reliable and free API is found, it can be integrated to automate the ISIN to ticker conversion.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4511" data-end="4608">
<p data-start="4513" data-end="4608"><strong data-start="4513" data-end="4540">Advanced Error Handling</strong>: Add better handling for missing or incorrect data during scraping.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="4610" data-end="4613">
<h2 data-start="4615" data-end="4628">Conclusion</h2>
<p data-start="4630" data-end="4918">After trying several approaches, I was able to create a working stock scraper that fetches data based on <strong data-start="4735" data-end="4750">NSE tickers</strong> and <strong data-start="4755" data-end="4769">ISIN codes</strong>. Despite facing multiple API and website-related challenges, I worked around them by hard-mapping stock names to their corresponding ticker symbols.</p>

<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="467" data-end="3879"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none rounded-t-[5px]">markdown</div><div class="sticky top-9"><div class="absolute end-0 bottom-0 flex h-9 items-center pe-2"><div class="bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary flex items-center rounded-sm px-2 font-sans text-xs"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-markdown"><span><span><span class="hljs-section"># Stock Scraper</span></span><span>

This project allows you to fetch stock data from </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Screener.in**</span></span><span> using </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**ISIN codes**</span></span><span>. However, during the implementation, we faced multiple challenges with </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**ISIN lookup**</span></span><span> and </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**API limitations**</span></span><span>, which led us to a </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**hard mapping approach**</span></span><span> for certain stocks.

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">## Problem Encountered</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">1.</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**ISIN Search Issue**</span></span><span>:  
   Initially, I attempted to search for stocks directly by their </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**ISIN**</span></span><span> codes. However, </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Screener.in**</span></span><span> did not support ISIN-based searches. It only accepts stock tickers, so I was unable to use ISIN codes to fetch data directly from the site.

</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">2.</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**API Attempts**</span></span><span>:
   I explored </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**external APIs**</span></span><span> to convert ISINs into stock tickers. Here's a list of the APIs I attempted:

</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">   -</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**FinancialModelingPrep API**</span></span><span>: I tried using their ISIN search API, but it either didn’t provide results or failed to return the correct ticker data.
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">   -</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Alpha Vantage API**</span></span><span>: While attempting to fetch stock data, the API key either didn’t work or the endpoint didn’t support ISIN-based queries.
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">   -</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Other Free APIs**</span></span><span>: I also searched for free APIs to convert ISINs to stock tickers but faced issues with access, rate limits, or incorrect data.

</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">3.</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Hard Mapping**</span></span><span>:
   After the external API attempts failed, I decided to </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**manually map the stock names**</span></span><span> and </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**tickers**</span></span><span> for a select list of stocks. This allowed me to bypass the ISIN lookup issue by directly searching for stocks via their ticker names on </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Screener.in**</span></span><span>.

   However, </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Screener.in**</span></span><span> requires using </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**NSE ticker symbols**</span></span><span> (e.g., </span><span><span class="hljs-code">`RELIANCE`</span></span><span> for </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Reliance Industries**</span></span><span>) in the URL, not the full stock name (e.g., </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Reliance Industries**</span></span><span>). So, I created a hard mapping to associate </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**stock names**</span></span><span> with their </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**NSE ticker symbols**</span></span><span>.

---

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">## Solution</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">### <span class="hljs-strong">**Approach I Finally Used:**</span></span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Hard Mapping of Ticker Symbols**</span></span><span>:  
  After failing to find a working API solution, I created a manual mapping of </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**ISIN codes**</span></span><span> to </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**stock names**</span></span><span> and their corresponding </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**NSE ticker symbols**</span></span><span>.
  
  Example:  
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">  -</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Reliance Industries**</span></span><span> → </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**`RELIANCE`**</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">  -</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Tata Consultancy Services**</span></span><span> → </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**`TCS`**</span></span><span>
  
  This allowed me to construct the correct </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Screener.in**</span></span><span> URL for each stock by using the corresponding </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**NSE ticker symbol**</span></span><span> in the URL (</span><span><span class="hljs-code">`https://www.screener.in/company/&lt;ticker&gt;/`</span></span><span>).

</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Fetching Stock Data**</span></span><span>:  
  After generating the correct ticker symbols for each stock, I used </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Python's BeautifulSoup**</span></span><span> to scrape key metrics (like P/E ratio, market cap, etc.) from </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Screener.in**</span></span><span>.

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">### <span class="hljs-strong">**Tools and Libraries Used**</span></span></span><span>:
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Requests**</span></span><span>: For making HTTP requests to </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Screener.in**</span></span><span> and other APIs.
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**BeautifulSoup**</span></span><span>: For scraping stock data from the </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Screener.in**</span></span><span> web page.
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Python**</span></span><span>: Used for scraping and data extraction logic.

---

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">## Development and Debugging</span></span><span>

During the development of the scraper, I encountered several </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**syntax and logical errors**</span></span><span>. To resolve them, I turned to </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**ChatGPT**</span></span><span> for assistance. Here’s what was fixed:

</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Syntax errors**</span></span><span>: I was able to get help fixing missing or mismatched parentheses and other Python syntax issues.
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Logical errors**</span></span><span>: ChatGPT helped me fix issues like handling missing data during the scraping process and correcting the mapping of ISINs to tickers.

---

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">## How to Use the Scraper</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">1.</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Clone the Repository**</span></span><span>:
   Clone this repository to your local machine using:
   <span class="hljs-code">```bash
   git clone https://github.com/your-username/stock-scraper.git
</span></span></span></code></div></div></pre>

<h2 data-start="4352" data-end="4366">Limitations</h2>
<ul data-start="4368" data-end="4627">
<li data-start="4368" data-end="4451">
<p data-start="4370" data-end="4451"><strong data-start="4370" data-end="4392">Limited Stock Data</strong>: Only stocks that are hard-mapped are currently supported.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4452" data-end="4627">
<p data-start="4454" data-end="4627"><strong data-start="4454" data-end="4485">No ISIN Support on Screener</strong>: The <strong data-start="4491" data-end="4506">Screener.in</strong> platform does not support ISIN-based searches, making it necessary to either use an external API or hard-map the stocks.</p>
</li>
</ul>

<h2 data-start="5004" data-end="5017">Conclusion</h2>
<p data-start="5019" data-end="5307">After trying several approaches, I was able to create a working stock scraper that fetches data based on <strong data-start="5124" data-end="5139">NSE tickers</strong> and <strong data-start="5144" data-end="5158">ISIN codes</strong>.
