Here's the <strong data-start="17" data-end="35">full README.md</strong> with <strong data-start="41" data-end="64">future improvements</strong> and <strong data-start="69" data-end="84">limitations</strong> included, following the structure we discussed:</p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="134" data-end="3546"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none rounded-t-[5px]">markdown</div><div class="sticky top-9"><div class="absolute end-0 bottom-0 flex h-9 items-center pe-2"><div class="bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary flex items-center rounded-sm px-2 font-sans text-xs"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-markdown"><span><span><span class="hljs-section"># Stock Scraper</span></span><span>

This project allows you to fetch stock data from </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Screener.in**</span></span><span> using </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**ISIN codes**</span></span><span>. However, during the implementation, we faced multiple challenges with </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**ISIN lookup**</span></span><span> and </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**API limitations**</span></span><span>, which led us to a </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**hard mapping approach**</span></span><span> for certain stocks.

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">## Problem Encountered</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">1.</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**ISIN Search Issue**</span></span><span>:  
   Initially, I attempted to search for stocks directly by their </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**ISIN**</span></span><span> codes. However, </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Screener.in**</span></span><span> did not support ISIN-based searches. It only accepts stock tickers, so I was unable to use ISIN codes to fetch data directly from the site.

</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">2.</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**API Attempts**</span></span><span>:
   I explored </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**external APIs**</span></span><span> to convert ISINs into stock tickers. Here's a list of the APIs I attempted:

</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">   -</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**FinancialModelingPrep API**</span></span><span>: I tried using their ISIN search API, but it either didn’t provide results or failed to return the correct ticker data.
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">   -</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Alpha Vantage API**</span></span><span>: While attempting to fetch stock data, the API key either didn’t work or the endpoint didn’t support ISIN-based queries.
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">   -</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Other Free APIs**</span></span><span>: I also searched for free APIs to convert ISINs to stock tickers but faced issues with access, rate limits, or incorrect data.

</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">3.</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Hard Mapping**</span></span><span>:
   After the external API attempts failed, I decided to </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**manually map the stock names**</span></span><span> and </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**tickers**</span></span><span> for a select list of stocks. This allowed me to bypass the ISIN lookup issue by directly searching for stocks via their ticker names on </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Screener.in**</span></span><span>.

   However, </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Screener.in**</span></span><span> requires using </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**NSE ticker symbols**</span></span><span> (e.g., </span><span><span class="hljs-code">`RELIANCE`</span></span><span> for </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Reliance Industries**</span></span><span>) in the URL, not the full stock name (e.g., </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Reliance Industries**</span></span><span>). So, I created a hard mapping to associate </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**stock names**</span></span><span> with their </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**NSE ticker symbols**</span></span><span>.

---

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">## Solution</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">### <span class="hljs-strong">**Approach I Finally Used:**</span></span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Hard Mapping of Ticker Symbols**</span></span><span>:  
  After failing to find a working API solution, I created a manual mapping of </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**ISIN codes**</span></span><span> to </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**stock names**</span></span><span> and their corresponding </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**NSE ticker symbols**</span></span><span>.
  
  Example:  
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">  -</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Reliance Industries**</span></span><span> → </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**`RELIANCE`**</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">  -</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Tata Consultancy Services**</span></span><span> → </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**`TCS`**</span></span><span>
  
  This allowed me to construct the correct </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Screener.in**</span></span><span> URL for each stock by using the corresponding </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**NSE ticker symbol**</span></span><span> in the URL (</span><span><span class="hljs-code">`https://www.screener.in/company/&lt;ticker&gt;/`</span></span><span>).

</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Fetching Stock Data**</span></span><span>:  
  After generating the correct ticker symbols for each stock, I used </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Python's BeautifulSoup**</span></span><span> to scrape key metrics (like P/E ratio, market cap, etc.) from </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Screener.in**</span></span><span>.

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">### <span class="hljs-strong">**Tools and Libraries Used**</span></span></span><span>:
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Requests**</span></span><span>: For making HTTP requests to </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Screener.in**</span></span><span> and other APIs.
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**BeautifulSoup**</span></span><span>: For scraping stock data from the </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Screener.in**</span></span><span> web page.
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Python**</span></span><span>: Used for scraping and data extraction logic.

---

</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Syntax errors**</span></span><span>: I was able to get help fixing missing or mismatched parentheses and other Python syntax issues.

The script will prompt you to enter an <strong data-start="3841" data-end="3854">ISIN code</strong>. It will then attempt to fetch stock data for the corresponding company using the <strong data-start="3937" data-end="3967">hard-mapped ticker symbols</strong> and scrape information from <strong data-start="3996" data-end="4011">Screener.in</strong>.</p>
</li>

<hr data-start="4014" data-end="4017">
<h2 data-start="4019" data-end="4033">Limitations</h2>
<ul data-start="4035" data-end="4763">
<li data-start="4035" data-end="4224">
<p data-start="4037" data-end="4224"><strong data-start="4037" data-end="4059">Limited Stock Data</strong>: Only stocks that are hard-mapped are currently supported. This means only a small selection of companies are available for data scraping based on their ISIN codes.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4225" data-end="4413">
<p data-start="4227" data-end="4413"><strong data-start="4227" data-end="4258">No ISIN Support on Screener</strong>: The <strong data-start="4264" data-end="4279">Screener.in</strong> platform does not support ISIN-based searches, which made it necessary to either use an external API or hard-map the stocks manually.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4414" data-end="4601">
<p data-start="4416" data-end="4601"><strong data-start="4416" data-end="4437">Scraping Reliance</strong>: The data scraping process depends on the structure of <strong data-start="4493" data-end="4508">Screener.in</strong>, so if the site changes its layout, the scraping function may break and require maintenance.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4602" data-end="4763">
<p data-start="4604" data-end="4763"><strong data-start="4604" data-end="4632">Limited Free API Options</strong>: Attempts to find free APIs for ISIN to stock ticker conversion failed due to access restrictions, API limits, or inaccurate data.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="4765" data-end="4768">
<h2 data-start="4770" data-end="4792">Future Improvements</h2>
<ul data-start="4794" data-end="5539">
<li data-start="4794" data-end="4948">
<p data-start="4796" data-end="4948"><strong data-start="4796" data-end="4819">Expand ISIN Mapping</strong>: More stocks can be mapped to their corresponding ISIN codes. Ideally, this would be automated by using a reliable external API.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4949" data-end="5143">
<p data-start="4951" data-end="5143"><strong data-start="4951" data-end="5000">Implement API-based ISIN to Ticker Conversion</strong>: If a reliable and free API is found, it can be integrated to automate the ISIN to ticker conversion, eliminating the need for manual mapping.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5144" data-end="5382">
<p data-start="5146" data-end="5382"><strong data-start="5146" data-end="5173">Advanced Error Handling</strong>: Add better handling for missing or incorrect data during scraping. This includes handling edge cases where data might not be available, and ensuring the script continues to work even if some data is missing.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5383" data-end="5539">
<p data-start="5385" data-end="5539"><strong data-start="5385" data-end="5403">User Interface</strong>: Implement a user interface (UI) that allows users to input multiple ISINs and view stock data in a more structured, user-friendly way.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="5541" data-end="5544">
<h2 data-start="5546" data-end="5559">Conclusion</h2>
<p data-start="5561" data-end="5849">After trying several approaches, I was able to create a working stock scraper that fetches data based on <strong data-start="5666" data-end="5681">NSE tickers</strong> and <strong data-start="5686" data-end="5700">ISIN codes</strong>. Despite facing multiple API and website-related challenges, I worked around them by hard-mapping stock names to their corresponding ticker symbols.</p>

Scraping Reliance: The data scraping process depends on the structure of Screener.in, so if the site changes its layout, the scraping function may break and require maintenance.

Limited Free API Options: Attempts to find free APIs for ISIN to stock ticker conversion failed due to access restrictions, API limits, or inaccurate data.

User Interface: Implement a user interface (UI) that allows users to input multiple ISINs and view stock data in a more structured, user-friendly way.

Conclusion
After trying several approaches, I was able to create a working stock scraper that fetches data based on NSE tickers and ISIN codes. Despite facing multiple API and website-related challenges, I worked around them by hard-mapping stock names to their corresponding ticker symbols.

<hr data-start="166" data-end="169">
<h1 data-start="171" data-end="186">Stock Scraper</h1>
<p data-start="188" data-end="449">This project allows you to fetch stock data from <strong data-start="237" data-end="252">Screener.in</strong> using <strong data-start="259" data-end="273">ISIN codes</strong>. However, during the implementation, we faced multiple challenges with <strong data-start="345" data-end="360">ISIN lookup</strong> and <strong data-start="365" data-end="384">API limitations</strong>, which led us to a <strong data-start="404" data-end="429">hard mapping approach</strong> for certain stocks.</p>
<h2 data-start="451" data-end="473">Problem Encountered</h2>
<ol data-start="475" data-end="1890">
<li data-start="475" data-end="748">
<p data-start="478" data-end="748"><strong data-start="478" data-end="499">ISIN Search Issue</strong>:<br data-start="500" data-end="503">
Initially, I attempted to search for stocks directly by their <strong data-start="568" data-end="576">ISIN</strong> codes. However, <strong data-start="593" data-end="608">Screener.in</strong> did not support ISIN-based searches. It only accepts stock tickers, so I was unable to use ISIN codes to fetch data directly from the site.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="750" data-end="1334">
<p data-start="753" data-end="878"><strong data-start="753" data-end="769">API Attempts</strong>:<br>
I explored <strong data-start="785" data-end="802">external APIs</strong> to convert ISINs into stock tickers. Here's a list of the APIs I attempted:</p>
<ul data-start="883" data-end="1334">
<li data-start="883" data-end="1034">
<p data-start="885" data-end="1034"><strong data-start="885" data-end="914">FinancialModelingPrep API</strong>: I tried using their ISIN search API, but it either didn’t provide results or failed to return the correct ticker data.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1038" data-end="1182">
<p data-start="1040" data-end="1182"><strong data-start="1040" data-end="1061">Alpha Vantage API</strong>: While attempting to fetch stock data, the API key either didn’t work or the endpoint didn’t support ISIN-based queries.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1186" data-end="1334">
<p data-start="1188" data-end="1334"><strong data-start="1188" data-end="1207">Other Free APIs</strong>: I also searched for free APIs to convert ISINs to stock tickers but faced issues with access, rate limits, or incorrect data.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li data-start="1336" data-end="1890">
<p data-start="1339" data-end="1614"><strong data-start="1339" data-end="1355">Hard Mapping</strong>:<br>
After the external API attempts failed, I decided to <strong data-start="1413" data-end="1445">manually map the stock names</strong> and <strong data-start="1450" data-end="1461">tickers</strong> for a select list of stocks. This allowed me to bypass the ISIN lookup issue by directly searching for stocks via their ticker names on <strong data-start="1598" data-end="1613">Screener.in</strong>.</p>
<p data-start="1619" data-end="1890">However, <strong data-start="1628" data-end="1643">Screener.in</strong> requires using <strong data-start="1659" data-end="1681">NSE ticker symbols</strong> (e.g., <code data-start="1689" data-end="1699">RELIANCE</code> for <strong data-start="1704" data-end="1727">Reliance Industries</strong>) in the URL, not the full stock name (e.g., <strong data-start="1772" data-end="1795">Reliance Industries</strong>). So, I created a hard mapping to associate <strong data-start="1840" data-end="1855">stock names</strong> with their <strong data-start="1867" data-end="1889">NSE ticker symbols</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="1892" data-end="1895">
<h2 data-start="1897" data-end="1908">Solution</h2>
<h3 data-start="1910" data-end="1942"><strong data-start="1914" data-end="1942">Approach I Finally Used:</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="1944" data-end="2643">
<li data-start="1944" data-end="2438">
<p data-start="1946" data-end="2143"><strong data-start="1946" data-end="1980">Hard Mapping of Ticker Symbols</strong>:<br data-start="1981" data-end="1984">
After failing to find a working API solution, I created a manual mapping of <strong data-start="2062" data-end="2076">ISIN codes</strong> to <strong data-start="2080" data-end="2095">stock names</strong> and their corresponding <strong data-start="2120" data-end="2142">NSE ticker symbols</strong>.</p>
<p data-start="2149" data-end="2159">Example:</p>
<ul data-start="2162" data-end="2253">
<li data-start="2162" data-end="2204">
<p data-start="2164" data-end="2204"><strong data-start="2164" data-end="2187">Reliance Industries</strong> → <strong data-start="2190" data-end="2204"><code data-start="2192" data-end="2202">RELIANCE</code></strong></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2207" data-end="2250">
<p data-start="2209" data-end="2250"><strong data-start="2209" data-end="2238">Tata Consultancy Services</strong> → <strong data-start="2241" data-end="2250"><code data-start="2243" data-end="2248">TCS</code></strong></p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="2256" data-end="2438">This allowed me to construct the correct <strong data-start="2297" data-end="2312">Screener.in</strong> URL for each stock by using the corresponding <strong data-start="2359" data-end="2380">NSE ticker symbol</strong> in the URL (<code data-start="2393" data-end="2436">https://www.screener.in/company/&lt;ticker&gt;/</code>).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2440" data-end="2643">
<p data-start="2442" data-end="2643"><strong data-start="2442" data-end="2465">Fetching Stock Data</strong>:<br data-start="2466" data-end="2469">
After generating the correct ticker symbols for each stock, I used <strong data-start="2538" data-end="2564">Python's BeautifulSoup</strong> to scrape key metrics (like P/E ratio, market cap, etc.) from <strong data-start="2627" data-end="2642">Screener.in</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="2645" data-end="2678"><strong data-start="2649" data-end="2677">Tools and Libraries Used</strong>:</h3>
<ul data-start="2679" data-end="2893">
<li data-start="2679" data-end="2754">
<p data-start="2681" data-end="2754"><strong data-start="2681" data-end="2693">Requests</strong>: For making HTTP requests to <strong data-start="2723" data-end="2738">Screener.in</strong> and other APIs.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2755" data-end="2834">
<p data-start="2757" data-end="2834"><strong data-start="2757" data-end="2774">BeautifulSoup</strong>: For scraping stock data from the <strong data-start="2809" data-end="2824">Screener.in</strong> web page.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2835" data-end="2893">
<p data-start="2837" data-end="2893"><strong data-start="2837" data-end="2847">Python</strong>: Used for scraping and data extraction logic.</p>
</li>
</ul>

It will then attempt to fetch stock data for the corresponding company using the <strong data-start="3962" data-end="3992">hard-mapped ticker symbols</strong> and scrape information from <strong data-start="4021" data-end="4036">Screener.in</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="4039" data-end="4042">
<h2 data-start="4044" data-end="4058">Limitations</h2>
<ul data-start="4060" data-end="4788">
<li data-start="4060" data-end="4249">
<p data-start="4062" data-end="4249"><strong data-start="4062" data-end="4084">Limited Stock Data</strong>: Only stocks that are hard-mapped are currently supported. This means only a small selection of companies are available for data scraping based on their ISIN codes.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4250" data-end="4438">
<p data-start="4252" data-end="4438"><strong data-start="4252" data-end="4283">No ISIN Support on Screener</strong>: The <strong data-start="4289" data-end="4304">Screener.in</strong> platform does not support ISIN-based searches, which made it necessary to either use an external API or hard-map the stocks manually.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4439" data-end="4626">
<p data-start="4441" data-end="4626"><strong data-start="4441" data-end="4462">Scraping Reliance</strong>: The data scraping process depends on the structure of <strong data-start="4518" data-end="4533">Screener.in</strong>, so if the site changes its layout, the scraping function may break and require maintenance.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4627" data-end="4788">
<p data-start="4629" data-end="4788"><strong data-start="4629" data-end="4657">Limited Free API Options</strong>: Attempts to find free APIs for ISIN to stock ticker conversion failed due to access restrictions, API limits, or inaccurate data.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="4790" data-end="4793">
<h2 data-start="4795" data-end="4817">Future Improvements</h2>
<ul data-start="4819" data-end="5564">
<li data-start="4819" data-end="4973">
<p data-start="4821" data-end="4973"><strong data-start="4821" data-end="4844">Expand ISIN Mapping</strong>: More stocks can be mapped to their corresponding ISIN codes. Ideally, this would be automated by using a reliable external API.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4974" data-end="5168">
<p data-start="4976" data-end="5168"><strong data-start="4976" data-end="5025">Implement API-based ISIN to Ticker Conversion</strong>: If a reliable and free API is found, it can be integrated to automate the ISIN to ticker conversion, eliminating the need for manual mapping.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5169" data-end="5407">
<p data-start="5171" data-end="5407"><strong data-start="5171" data-end="5198">Advanced Error Handling</strong>: Add better handling for missing or incorrect data during scraping. This includes handling edge cases where data might not be available, and ensuring the script continues to work even if some data is missing.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5408" data-end="5564">
<p data-start="5410" data-end="5564"><strong data-start="5410" data-end="5428">User Interface</strong>: Implement a user interface (UI) that allows users to input multiple ISINs and view stock data in a more structured, user-friendly way.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="5566" data-end="5569">
<h2 data-start="5571" data-end="5584">Conclusion</h2>
<p data-start="5586" data-end="5874">After trying several approaches, I was able to create a working stock scraper that fetches data based on <strong data-start="5691" data-end="5706">NSE tickers</strong> and <strong data-start="5711" data-end="5725">ISIN codes</strong>. Despite facing multiple API and website-related challenges, I worked around them by hard-mapping stock names to their corresponding ticker symbols.</p>
